channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Campus Community Invited to Cybersecurity Meetup with FBI, ISC2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - All are welcome to join the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory and DotCIO in Carnegie 113 for the first meeting of the new ISC2 Capital District NY Chapter, which will meet monthly. This month, Samantha Baltzersen, Supervisory Special Agent in Charge of Cyber for Albany FBI Field Office, will give a talk. Please contact Dr. Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Meeting
item.description: The Quantum Computing Users Group will meet on Wednesday, July 31st, from noon to 1 pm, in Amos Eaton 214. A number of our members are attending the IBM Qiskit Summer School. Their experiences and other topics the group is interested in will be discussed. Please join us! RSVP: Tom Morgan, morgat5@rpi.edu
item.author: Community

item.title: Tanglewood Music Center’s Fromm Quartet to Perform at EMPAC
item.description: Presented by RPI, the Tanglewood Music Center’s Fromm Quartet will perform “Storytelling and Memory” at the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Music and Performing Arts Center (EMPAC) on Friday, August 2 at 7:00PM, featuring works by members of Tanglewood’s composition faculty and co-directors of the Festival of Contemporary Music. Please register for free admission!
item.author: Community

item.title: Arts Department to Present “Transcroporeality” Installation at EMPAC
item.description: Friday, July 26, 2024 – “Transcroporeality” is a trial of immersive multi-modal work by Allie Wist that incorporates smell and video related to the anthropocene, microplastics, hybrid geology, and late industrialisms. Most information about ecological demise is depicted through data or visuals, and this installation attempts to prioritize more embodied contact points with Anthropogenic changes to the environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: CCPD Virtual Summer Series Continues with Crane Currency Info Session
item.description: Join the team at Crane Currency from 6:30PM to 7:30PM on Thursday, July 25 to learn about career paths and company culture within the organization, as well as upcoming opportunities for Arch students seeking an Away experience! Also please review theChemical Engineering R&D Internship or Co-Op opportunity posted in Handshake.
item.author: Students

item.title: Summer Outdoor Program Series to Include River Tubing Trip
item.description: Date: Saturday, July 27, 2024 11:00 AM - 4:00 PM - Arch students are invited to join the Mueller Center’s river tubing trip, which will take place on the Battenkill River, located on the New York/Vermont border! This trip is limited to ten participants and registration is required; please look for information and registration on the Muller Center’s Instagram page, or contact Will Weinert if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Summer Arch 2024 NYC Trip Slated for July 27
item.description: Date: Saturday, July 27, 2024 8:00 AM - The Class of 2026 Council and The Arch Summer Ambassadors would like to invite current Arch students to join them for a day in New York City. Space is limited and registration is required, so register soon!…
item.author: Students

item.title: Update: Time Changed for CCPD July 29 URP/Handshake Faculty Training Session
item.description:
On Monday, July 29 from 2:00PM to 3:30PM in the CCPD conference room, the CCPD will host an interactive opportunity for faculty members to learn how to use Handshake for posting undergraduate research positions. Light snacks will be provided. Space is limited, so interested faculty should submit a registration webform to sign up as soon as possible.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
